chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Krause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Judgment for Restitution After Revocation of Probation

supervisions.notes: Probation to begin on October 20, 2014.  50 days credit if revoked.  Chippewa County Case Nos. 14CF276 and 14CM109 are dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes:
$449.52 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $44.95.  Defendant to set up a payment plan within sixty (60) days with Probation Agent.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated August 4, 2015, $199.52 represents restitution plus a surcharge of $44.95.  Defendant to set up payment plan within 60 days with probation agent.  Co-defendant, Jolene Anderson had a cash bond of $250 that was applied to restitution.

Defendant to set up a payment plan within sixty (60) days with Probation Agent.  Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents the DNA Surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs or prescription drugs not prescribed.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No contact with:  Jolene Anderson, Steven Anderson, Jamie Krause or Lori Mueller without prior approved permission from Probation Agent.
Submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
